content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player, I would analyze this game strategically to maximize my earnings over the 75 rounds.

In this game, choosing R when the other player picks B gives a higher payoff of 40$ compared to 20$ for choosing B when the other player picks R. However, if both players choose R simultaneously, we both get 45$. Since the opponent is anonymous and I cannot predict their choices accurately, it would be risky to rely on the higher payoff from choosing R when they pick B.

On the other hand, choosing B ensures that I will earn at least 20$ in each round where my opponent chooses R, and if both of us choose B, we'll still earn a guaranteed 20$. Since the game has 75 rounds, it is more likely to have at least one opponent who picks B frequently enough for me to benefit from choosing B myself.

Therefore, as a human player, I would opt to pick 'B' to minimize risk and maximize earnings in the long run (over the 75 rounds). {B}
